intro: Cynorkis monadenia, commonly known as the Cape orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, showy flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, grass-like leaves and a single, erect stem. Its flowers are usually pale green to yellowish in color, with a distinct, spurred lip that aids in pollination by specific insect species. Cynorkis monadenia thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
